properties.name: Sakurajima (Aira Caldera)
properties.notes: One of Japan's most active volcanoes. Frequent small explosions and ash plumes.

properties.name: Aso (Nakadake crater)
properties.notes: Large caldera with historically active central cones (Nakadake).

properties.name: Shinmoedake (Kirishima)
properties.notes: Explosive eruptions in recent decades; closely monitored.

properties.name: Unzen (Unzen-Fugen lava dome complex)
properties.notes: Historic deadly eruptions (1792 tsunami); significant seismic/volcanic hazards.

properties.name: Mt. Fuji
properties.alert_level: Designated active (long repose); monitoring in place
properties.notes: Dormant historically but capable of large eruptions and associated seismicity.

properties.name: Mount Ontake
properties.notes: Phreatic eruptions can occur with little precursory seismicity — dangerous.

properties.name: Usu
properties.notes: Recent eruptions with significant seismic swarms and deformation.

properties.name: Tokachidake
properties.notes: Produces eruptions and earthquake swarms; monitored by JMA.

properties.name: Mt. Meakan
properties.notes: Part of Akan volcanic region; fumarolic and explosive activity recorded.

properties.name: Miyake-jima
properties.notes: Large 2000 eruption led to island evacuation; strong gas and seismic monitoring.

properties.name: Izu-Oshima
properties.notes: Near Tokyo; capable of explosive activity and local seismic swarms.

properties.name: Mount Bandai
properties.notes: 1888 eruption produced major debris avalanches; potential for seismic-volcanic coupling.
